alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Scotts Bluff and south central Sioux Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout near Morrill, or 11 miles west of Scottsbluff, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mitchell and Morrill around 725 PM MDT. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
